==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|ま|じゅつ|し|yomi=on}}

===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=まじゅつし|魔術|tr1=majutsu|t1=magic, sorcery|師|tr2=shi|t2=master, practitioner}}.

===Pronunciation===
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|音読み|On'yomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|n|ま|じゅつ|し}}<ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[ma̠d͡ʑɯᵝt͡sɯᵝɕi]}}

===Alternative forms===
* {{ja-l|魔術士}} {{qualifier|uncommon}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|まじゅつし}}

# [[magician]], [[conjurer]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=まじゅつし|fantasy}} a user of [[magic]]: a [[sorcerer]], [[witch]], [[wizard]], or [[mage]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=まじゅつし|tarot}}: the [[magician|Magician]], the first [[trump]] or [[major arcana]] [[card]] in most traditional tarot decks

====Synonyms====
* {{ja-l|魔法師|まほうし|mahōshi}}
* {{ja-l|魔道師}}, {{ja-l|魔導師|まどうし|madōshi}}

====Derived terms====
* {{ja-l|女魔術師|おんなまじゅつし|onna majutsushi}}: a [[female]] magician; a [[sorceress]]

====See also====
* {{pedialite|lang=ja}}
